title: [Workshop] Smart Cities and Mobility Research - August 04-08 '25
description:
This intensive workshop, led by Dr Jens Kandt, Dr Joana Barros and Prof. Jon Reades of University College London, focused on applying advanced technologies, including Geographic Information Systems (GIS), IoT, and data analytics, to solve modern urban challenges. Participants were trained to use these tools for real-time decision-making, aiming to optimise urban infrastructure, mobility, and public services with a focus on sustainable and inclusive strategies relevant to India. 

The hands-on sessions equipped attendees with technical skills in programming, data management, and reproducible analysis. Key topics included understanding mobility in data-scarce contexts, visualising complex urban data, and addressing social issues through transparent analysis. A central theme was the promotion of an open data culture to accelerate the development of smart, resilient, and equitable cities.

title: [Workshop] A Data Driven Approach Towards Smart Cities - July 21-27 '25
description:
The workshop provided an intensive, five-day training to explore how urban data can be harnessed to build efficient, resilient, and citizen-centric cities, led by Dr. Mehran Eskandari Torbaghan of the University of Birmingham and Drs. Nand Kumar and Satish Pipralia of MNIT Jaipur. Participants gained practical experience through hands-on modules focused on creating visualisations, building digital dashboards, and simulating urban systems using AI and GIS platforms.

Key sessions covered critical urban issues, including designing data collection strategies for smart mobility, mitigating urban heat islands, and data-driven decision-making for asset and risk management. The curriculum also culminates in participant presentations.
